main_definition: In English, 'pas' usually refers to the concept of not doing something or the absence of action, often used in negative sentences.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not to do something or an act of omission
meanings_and_examples.example: He took a pas on helping with the project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The absence or lack of something
meanings_and_examples.example: There was no pas in her life after she moved abroad.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To fail to do a particular task or action
meanings_and_examples.example: He didn't pass the exam because he forgot to study.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some languages, 'pas' is used in negation similar to 'not'. For example, in French and Spanish.
meanings_and_examples.example: Je ne mange pas. (I do not eat.)
